intro: Hieracium intricatum, commonly known as the intricate hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in grassy areas and disturbed soils. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are typically hairy and have a rough texture, while its stems are upright and sometimes branched. Hieracium intricatum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
